bomberMan.gamePlay.Model

Class BomberMan

  • java.lang.Object
    • bomberMan.gamePlay.Model.GameObject
      • bomberMan.gamePlay.Model.Character
        • bomberMan.gamePlay.Model.BomberMan
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Position, java.io.Serializable

    public class BomberMan
extends Character
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class implements a set of methods that allow the insertion of the Bomberman object in a game board. The documentation for the methods contained in this class includes briefs descriptions of the implementations. Such descriptions should be regarded as implementation notes, rather than parts of specifications
    Author:
    Andres Felipe Rincon Gamboa
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • BomberMan

        public BomberMan(int xPos,
                 int yPos)
        Constructor This method takes care of any initialization needed for the BomberMan private variables. BomberMan has a list of powerUps where it gets updated every time he picks a powerUp and also we keep track of the bombs bomberMan drops for detonating purposes.
        Parameters:
        xPos - the x position of the bomberman on the x axis of the game board.
        yPos - the y position of the bomberman on the x axis of the game board.

    • Method Detail

      • infoToString

        public void infoToString()
        This method prints out the position of bomberMan for debugging purposes. It should be deleted at the end of the project. When everything is tested out, or moved to testing package.

      • addBomb

        public void addBomb(Bomb objectBomb)
